name: Hilton Garden Inn Troy

reviews.text: We were in Troy, NY for a family event. We called ahead for a shuttle to pick us up from the airport and we were happy to see a black escalade pull up. It's free of charge (we did tip the driver). Pros: Great Staff (Nicole was super helpful!), property was clean and looked well maintained. We used the gym (small but worked), the pool (indoors), and the buffet (really good and very affordable $6-$11), needed extra towels and a cot which were easy to get. When we return to Troy, we will stay here again.
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay
An Unpleasant Stay in Upstate New York
reviews.text: When I first checked into the Hilton Garden Inn Troy I thought that I would be staying in a clean, well kept, decent establishment for a night's sleep. The hotel seemed pretty new looking online, being opened in 2009, it usually signals a cleaner hotel. Yet, my expectations were completely off.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The person at the front desk was nice, cordial, and prompt to check me into my room. She welcomed me to the hotel, gave me instructions on how to connect to the internet, and told me about some of the security features installed since Troy is not the safest city in New York.
reviews.title: We loved it!

reviews.text: Upon entering my room I opened my door and I noticed that the wall shook, and made a noise similar to two balloons rubbing against each other. I never knew that a laminate and a thin piece of plastic was an acceptable division between a room and a stairwell. This first impression should have foreshadowed my quality of sleep for the upcoming night. As I proceeded to inspect my suite I went into the kitchenette area and noticed some mold growing on the floor near the mini fridge, officially grossing me out. Along with the paper clip sticking up from the carpet, the garbage found in a drawer in the kitchenette, and the additional mold growing on the floor in the bathroom made me loose all faith in housekeeping at this establishment.
reviews.title: A Hilton in name only

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedding on the main bed was perfectly suitable, clean and fresh smelling, however the pathetic excuse of a cot that the hotel provided for my son was of the cheapest quality I have ever seen. He told me that the book that he was reading at the time (Fast Food Nation) was thicker than the mattress on the cot (he actually compared), and the sheets had to be 90% polyester and 10% cotton (a thread count of 150 would be generous).
reviews.title: Excellent Wedding Experience

reviews.text: While we did not personally stay at the hotel, we used it as our base of operations for all our out of town family during our daughter's wedding. Our family expressed their satisfaction with their hotel stay.
reviews.title: Two Events -----One Happy Memory

reviews.text: We hosted a get together after the wedding and a family brunch the following day. Kim, our event coordinator and catering manager, made hosting our events very easy. She was always friendly and considerate of our wishes. All we had to do was sit back and enjoy! Waitstaff provided excellent service catering to all our needs. They were dedicated to everyone having a good time. For example, Nancy, who oversaw the get together, even visited us at the Sunday brunch to make sure everything was going well.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but bad service

reviews.text: If you have a social event coming up, you should consider the Hilton Garden Inn of Troy, NY.
reviews.title: Nice & NEW, with sports bar attached

reviews.text: I had requested an early check in since I was traveling to Troy to attend a wedding. I called the hotel and asked if this could be accommodated. They said yes. When I arrived, they said the room would be ready in a half hour. I returned and was told it would be ready "sometime" after lunch. I had to get ready in a relative's room and could not check in until 8pm. Also the fire alarm went off at 10:30 pm. Not a real fire but it just added to my displeasure with this place.
reviews.title: HGI< Troy NY

reviews.text: In town for business and this place is probably the best business travel hotel in town. The Recovery Sports Bar & Grill downstairs is good too.
reviews.title: Nice facilities for the price

reviews.text: Stayed here on my Hilton HHonors Points with my husband and 18 y.o. son who will be going to RPI next fall. The hotel was very nice. Same as the traveler before me, we got the 2 free bottles of water upon arrival (and I'm Silver, not Gold) as well as the warm cookies. (No free breakfast though)
reviews.title: Great stay with family
Great experience at the Hilton Garden Inn in Troy
reviews.text: The beds take a little getting used to. The comfort level is adjustable. It was fine for me but both my husband and son couldn't seem to get the mattress to a comfortable setting for them.

The hotel was sold out the night we were there (RPI incoming freshman event the next day) and the pool was very crowded as was the sports bar, although I think there were a lot of locals at the latter. The sports bar was very nice with lots of big screens with just about every event on one screen or another. The food was good too but it took a little while to get served due to it being busy. No big deal for us.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, comfy rooms

reviews.text: Complimentary wireless internet in the room was nice and very fast. We really put it to use, with 2 laptops and 3 smart phones all connected at the same time.
reviews.title: Convenient location, ok sports bar/restaurant, comfortable and clean
Great stay, quiet and clean
reviews.text: As would be expected with a sold out hotel, the dining room was pretty mobbed for breakfast but we managed to get in and have a quick one before heading out.

Stayed here for 1 night before bringing my son to a leadership weekend at RPI. The front desk staff was helpful and courteous. I really liked that a room key has to be used to access any guest floor in the elevator. This is a nice security feature. The beds are comfortable and the rooms very clean. I like that they launder the duvets and decorative pillows for every guest as well as the sheets. That's a nice upgrade from places with the usual bedspreads that seem so yucky. I would have liked free breakfast, but the continental breakfast is $6.95. Other similar chains give this as part of the stay. The $11.95 breakfast buffet is nice with very good omelets, bacon and homefries. I will stay here again when in the area.
reviews.title: Clean, Comfortable, Good Security, Great Service close to RPI

reviews.text: The hotel is easily accessible from Rt. 87, It is clean, new and with friendly staff. It has a great sports bar on premises. The breakfast buffet was good and reasonably priced. I will definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: If you don't mind a little drive to visit attractions near NY's capitol region, this is a very satisfying hotel. Sitting on a hill in the tired city of Troy is a sparkling clean, stylish, comfortable HGI that really delivers value. From the sports pub's delicious food to the large, comfortable lobby to the good sized rooms, this hotel was great. We stayed with a team of 140 kids and many adults and they accommodated every need amazingly well. The hotel was packed, but didn't seem so.
reviews.title: The best Hilton Garden Inn ever

reviews.text: Stayed one night as a guest using a gift voucher. Breakfast for two was included. Internet was free and the beds were adjustable to accommodate desired firmness. Duvet cover is replaced when each guest arrives. I liked this. I also liked the fact that you needed your room key in the elevator to gain access to the rooms. Breakfast was fresh and service was second to none. I would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton Garden is the best hotel Troy has had in many years. I travel to Troy annually for 2 nights with my wife to a fraternity reunion. I've been doing it for 30 and have seen several hotels come and go in Troy. We got a decent group rate ($109). The location is convenient, plenty of free parking, rooms are adequate, sports bar is good, staff were all friendly and helpful. We did not use the fitness facility or the pool but others said they were good. Drinks are expensive ($7 for average wine or mixed drink). Only dislike was the food and service at a banquet we attended there. My wife's dinner was so salty that she couldn't eat it. The wait staff were slow and inattentive, such as, didn't refill water glasses or coffee. Been there two years running and will definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Best you can get in Troy
